headline.main: ASHORE NEAR BEACH HAVEN.; THE SAILING SHIP EMILY F. WHITNEY COMES TO GRIEF.

docs.snippet: ST. JOHN, N.B., Nov. 14 -- Capt. S.T. Wolfe of Fort Medway, who was in charge of the schoonor Arbutus when the vessel was wrecked on Old Proprietor Shoal Thursday night, reports that on Thursday at 9 A.M., when she passed Seal Island, the wind had...
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. JOHN, N.B., Nov. 14 -- Capt. S.T. Wolfe of Fort Medway, who was in charge of the schoonor Arbutus when the vessel was wrecked on Old Proprietor Shoal Thursday night, reports that on Thursday at 9 A.M., when she passed Seal Island, the wind had increased to a gale, accompanied by rain. At times it was impossible to see further than the bow.

headline.main: THE WRECK OF THE ARBUTUS.; CAPT. WOLFE GIVES A THRILLING ACCOUNT OF THE DISASTER.

ONLY NINE WERE SAVED; WRECK OF THE ROUMANIA ON THE PORTUGUESE COAST. OF PASSENGERS AND CREW NUMBERING 122 THESE WERE LOST 113 -- THE CAPTAIN AND PILOT AMONG THE VICTIMS -- SEVENTEEN DROWNED IN ANOTHER DISASTER.
ALL LOST BUT TWO.; THE HONDURAS SCHOONER STRANGER CAPSIZED IN A HURRICANE.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 11 -- The Cunard Line steamer Servia, from New-York Sept. 3 for Liverpool, which arrived at Queenstown at 8:15 o'clock this morning, had a narrow escape from serious disaster last Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 11 -- The Cunard Line steamer Servia, from New-York Sept. 3 for Liverpool, which arrived at Queenstown at 8:15 o'clock this morning, had a narrow escape from serious disaster last Tuesday.

headline.main: SERVIA'S NARROW ESCAPE; A HARMLESS COLLISION IN MID-OCEAN. THE STEAMER RAN INTO THE SHIP UNDAUNTED -- A DENSE FOG CAUSED THE ACCIDENT -- NEITHER VESSEL INJURED -- MANY OF THE PASSENGERS NOT AWAKENED.

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Sept. 6. -- The financial returns on-the investment in grand opera at the new Alhambra, at the corner of State Street and Archer Avenue, have not been great. Miss Juch and her fellow-artists have demonstrated their ability to sing delight...
docs.abstract: Continental; Collision with the C. H. Northam
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Sept. 6. -- The financial returns on-the investment in grand opera at the new Alhambra, at the corner of State Street and Archer Avenue, have not been great. Miss Juch and her fellow-artists have demonstrated their ability to sing delightfully a certain class of operas, but the new theatre has proved that it is not in a locality where grand opera thrives.

docs.snippet: The Hamburg-American steamship Dania, commanded by Capt. Schultz, which left Hamburg for this port Aug. 9, went ashore Wednesday night at 11 o'clock on the bar, about one mile from Point Lookout, between New and Sones Inlets, Long Island. Practica...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Hamburg-American steamship Dania, commanded by Capt. Schultz, which left Hamburg for this port Aug. 9, went ashore Wednesday night at 11 o'clock on the bar, about one mile from Point Lookout, between New and Sones Inlets, Long Island. Practically no attempts to get her off were made yesterday, and up to a late hour last night she lay fast in the sand in an exceedingly dangerous position.

headline.main: THE DANIA GOES ASHORE; A GERMAN STEAMSHIP FAST ON A LONG ISLAND SANDBAR. HER PASSENGERS SAFELY TAKEN OFF BY THE AUGUSTA VICTORIA AND BROUGHT UP TO THIS CITY.

docs.snippet: BALTIMORE, July 28. -- The city is greatly excited to-night by the report of a collision in the Patapsco River, several miles below the city. The Louise, the largest excursion steamer on the Chesapeake Bay, was bringing to the city about 1,400 pas...
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, July 28. -- The city is greatly excited to-night by the report of a collision in the Patapsco River, several miles below the city. The Louise, the largest excursion steamer on the Chesapeake Bay, was bringing to the city about 1,400 passengers from Tolchester, the excursion resort below Annapolis. About 8:15 she was passing the bend this side of Sparrow's Point and was making her way up mid-channel.

headline.main: STEAMBOATS IN COLLISION; MORE THAN ONE THOUSAND LIVES IN GREAT PERIL. FOUR LIVES KNOWN TO HAVE BEEN LOST -- MANY EXCURSIONISTS MISSING -- CAUSE OF THE DISASTER.

docs.snippet: HALIFAX, N.S., Oct. 9.--Capt. J.W. Liswell of the ship Minnie Swift, which was lost in collision with the French steamer Geographique off St. Pierre, Miquelon, has arrived here. He states that nothing of importance occurred until the llth, when th...
docs.abstract: Minnie Swift Sunk by the Geographique
docs.lead_paragraph: HALIFAX, N.S., Oct. 9.--Capt. J.W. Liswell of the ship Minnie Swift, which was lost in collision with the French steamer Geographique off St. Pierre, Miquelon, has arrived here. He states that nothing of importance occurred until the llth, when the bark Zuletta was fallen in with, dismasted and waterlogged.

headline.main: VESSELS IN COLLISION.; THE MINNIE SWIFT CUT DOWN AND SEVERAL LIVES LOST.

headline.main: A STEAMSHIP WRECKED.; THE MONTREAL ON THE ROCKS, BUT NO LIVES LOST.
